FuncDef:
The max-tcp-num command configures the maximum number of TCP connections to HTTP server for each IP address.
The undo max-tcp-num command restores the default value to the number of TCP connections to HTTP server for each IP address. The max-tcp-num command configures the maximum number of TCP connections to HTTP server for each IP address. The undo max-tcp-num command restores the default value to the number of TCP connections to HTTP server for each IP address. By default, the maximum number of connections for each IP address is 30.

ParaDef.Info:
Configure the maximum number of connections for each IP address.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 30.
